meanings.sent1: She relined her favorite jacket with soft fabric.
meanings.sent2: The tailor relined the curtains to make them look new.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel relined its nest with cozy leaves for winter.
meanings.sent4: He relined his thoughts with positivity after a tough day.
meanings.sent5: The artist relined the painting with vibrant colors, bringing it to life.

meanings.definition: To put a new lining in.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic relined the brake pads for better performance.
meanings.sent2: She relined the birdcage with fresh newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The chef relined the baking pan with parchment paper.
meanings.sent4: He relined the suitcase with a waterproof material for the trip.
meanings.sent5: The gardener relined the flower pot to prevent water leakage.

meanings.definition: To cover the inside surface of something with a new layer.
meanings.sent1: She relined the drawer with scented paper to keep clothes fresh.
meanings.sent2: The workers relined the pool with a durable coating.
meanings.sent3: The baker relined the cake tin with butter and flour.
meanings.sent4: He relined the roof with sturdy tiles to withstand the storm.
meanings.sent5: The decorator relined the walls with colorful wallpaper for a cheerful look.
